channel.title: EXE to PNG converter and PNG to EXE converter, CODED IN JAVA! :D
channel.description:
Hi, I just made a program in java, the title say what it is.
pics (NOTE : the pics is on the EXE to PNG but the PNG to EXE is exactly the same thing.) ___________
This is what it give when you start it. [img]http://d.imagehost.org/0441/1_44.png[/img]
I tested it on iTunes. [img]http://b.imagehost.org/0654/2_8.png[/img]
You enter the new name (PNG name) [img]http://d.imagehost.org/0191/3_7.png[/img]
Then it created the image. [img]http://b.imagehost.org/0321/4_6.png[/img]
That's what it will give! :D [img]http://b.imagehost.org/0943/iTunes.png[/img]
All coded in java.
Rate it /10, post your comments and suggestions!! :D
[url=http://download980.mediafire.com/9c9ehmi3p8sg/a227tujlfsj991s/EXE+to+PNG+converter%21.rar]Download[/url] 2.79 KB, JAVA ftw? Direct link for you guys! :D NOTE : The PNG or EXE you want to convert must be in the same file than the class and the batch file.
Thanks for reading this! :D

item.title: EXE to PNG converter and PNG to EXE converter, CODED IN JAVA! :D
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[code]import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.PrintStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

public class converter
{
static byte[] imagebytes;
static String saveto = “”;

public static void main(String[] paramArrayOfString) { int i = 1;
while (i != 0) {
Scanner localScanner = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println(“NOTE : Your EXE or PNG must be in the same file than the program!”);
System.out.println(“ImageStore by: Demoniax”);
System.out.println(“Choose an option: “);
System.out.println(“1=EXE to PNG”);
System.out.println(“2=PNG to EXE”);
System.out.println(”_______________________”);
System.out.println("");
int j = localScanner.nextInt();
if (j == 2) {
imagetofile();
} else if (j == 1) {
filetoimage();
} else {
i = 0;
System.out.println(“Invalid Choice.”);
}
} }

public static void imagetofile() {
String str1 = “”;
Scanner localScanner = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println(“Enter the name of your image.”);
str1 = localScanner.next();
try
{
BufferedImage localBufferedImage = ImageIO.read(new File(str1));
byte[] arrayOfByte = new byte[localBufferedImage.getHeight() * localBufferedImage.getWidth()];
int i = localBufferedImage.getWidth() - 1;
int j = localBufferedImage.getHeight() - 1;
int k = 0;
System.out.println("Opening image. . . ");
for (int m = 0; m <= j; m++) {
System.out.println(Integer.toString(k) + “/” + Integer.toString(arrayOfByte.length));
for (int n = 0; n <= i; n++) {
int i1 = localBufferedImage.getRGB(n, m);
int i2 = i1 >> 16 & 0xFF;
arrayOfByte[k] = (byte)i2;
k += 1;
}
}
System.out.println(“Enter the new name of the file:”);
String str2 = localScanner.next();
try
{
FileOutputStream localFileOutputStream = new FileOutputStream(str2 + “.exe”);
localFileOutputStream.write(arrayOfByte);
localFileOutputStream.close();
}
catch (Exception localException2)
{
System.out.println("FileNotFoundException : " + localException2);
}
System.out.println(“File saved:”);
System.out.println(str2 + “.exe”);
System.out.println(“Finished!”);
}
catch (Exception localException1)
{
System.out.println(localException1.getMessage());
}
}

public static void filetoimage() {
try {
String str = “”;
Scanner localScanner = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println(“Enter the name of your exe.”);
str = localScanner.next();
FileInputStream localFileInputStream = new FileInputStream(str);

  DataInputStream localDataInputStream = new DataInputStream(localFileInputStream);
  byte[] arrayOfByte = new byte[localDataInputStream.available()];
  int i = 0;
  System.out.println("Reading bytes, please wait . . .");
  while (localDataInputStream.available() != 0) {
    arrayOfByte[i] = localDataInputStream.readByte();
    i += 1;
  }
  localDataInputStream.close();
  imagebytes = arrayOfByte;
  System.out.println("Enter the new name of the file:");
  saveto = localScanner.next();
  int j = 0;
  int k = 1;
  int m = (int)Math.sqrt(arrayOfByte.length) + 2;

  BufferedImage localBufferedImage = new BufferedImage(m, m, 1);
  System.out.println("Creating image . . . 0/" + Integer.toString(arrayOfByte.length));
  for (int i4 = 0; i4 < m; i4++) {
    System.out.println("Creating image . . . " + Integer.toString(j) + "/" + Integer.toString(arrayOfByte.length));
    for (int i5 = 0; i5 < m; i5++) {
      if (j < arrayOfByte.length - 1) {
        int n = arrayOfByte[j];
        int i1 = k;
        int i2 = k;
        int i3 = 0xFF000000 | n << 16 | i1 << 8 | i2;
        localBufferedImage.setRGB(i5, i4, i3);
        j += 1;
        k += 1;
        if (k == 253) {
          k = 1;
        }
      }
    }
  }
  System.out.println("Saving image.");
  ImageIO.write(localBufferedImage, "png", new File(saveto + ".png"));
  System.out.println("Image saved:");
  System.out.println(saveto + ".png");
  System.out.println("Finished.");
}
catch (Exception localException) {
  System.err.println(localException.getMessage());
}

}
}[/code]
I take it you forgot to post the source, so I did it for you

Anyways, completely useless, but ya. There is, in fact, more than just renaming going on here.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=470204.msg3438019#msg3438019 date=1292903877]

^ Justin never said it was for fun lol

I support this… And @ your previous quote:

Whether or not its constructed from the same data is irrelevant. There is still some sort of background work going on. Simply renaming an executable’s extension to .png and then trying to open it in a graphics program will not work most, if not all of the time.
[/quote]Instead of you attempting to explain the ‘background’ work on this, why not let the OP explain it?

Because, if this is in fact his, he would know the basics of what it is doing, and how it works.
Also, the name is blocked out on it, which gives me more reason not to trust this.[/quote]

It doesn’t matter who created it, because Java can’t edit Console titles without native interaction, so it is just a simple batch line… And no one would know about the background work unless they go into Java’s source, or read the docs for it. I was just proving Davidi2 wrong because it is not a direct copy, there is some slight changes.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:374218”][quote author=laurent 248 link=topic=470204.msg3437904#msg3437904 date=1292895752]

This will definitely go to use. Now I can do nothing.

Finally someone who understands.

List of People who read the post and understands that the program is not only renaming

-me

-HcoJustin

-Liquid Magic

Is this long for a coder forums?
This program is just for fun! There’s no serve or point downloading that, it’s just for fun! It’s only 3 KB, not like a 20 GB program!
[/quote]You realize Liquid was being sarcastic, right? XD

[quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=470204.msg3437901#msg3437901 date=1292895568]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=470204.msg3437898#msg3437898 date=1292895348]

You can rename a file, congratulations!

Rename what?
[/quote]Taking all of the bytes in one file, then making a new file with exactly the same bytes but a different name, is called renaming.

Look at the bytecode. It does more than that because images have a certain header, that must present.
[/quote]Look at his code, and tell me where it contains a header… all he’s doing is shifting the bytes so that they can represent colors…

Last I checked all extensions of Image contained this, so even if he is just calling setRGB on a BufferedImage, when saved it contains it.

But he’s still just creating an image from the same bytes…[/quote]

Sorry I coted wrong person and I didn’t read the code.

then its just justin and me
